ygData.subject: Re: Some races/places have all the luck
ygData.msgSnippet: Speaking of Trolls and their cloth armor collected from level 1 kills, I found a magic netted shirt that was 4AC.  This was equivalent of the AC on my guild
ygData.messageBody:
Speaking of Trolls and their cloth armor collected from level 1 kills, I
found a magic netted shirt that was 4AC. This was equivalent of the AC on
my guild tunic but when I offered it to a merchant, they were ready to buy
it from me for 8 gold. I still don't know what's magical about it though.
It doesn't improve any skills or stats that I can see.


-----Original Message-----
From: Virginia Renaut <vrenaut@...>
To: bristlebane_eq@onelist.com <bristlebane_eq@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, April 12, 1999 1:52 PM
Subject: [Bristlebane_EQ] Some races/places have all the luck


>From: Virginia Renaut <vrenaut@...>
>
>After dabbling in a few races in a few homelands, I really start to hate
>Freeport and the commonlands.
>
>Did you know that a Troll turn in 3 items (two found on a 1st level monster
>almost all the time, and another available on 4th level monsters
occasionally)
>and get an item worth 2+ gp? And they can do this repeatedly? Not to
mention
>that the 1st and 4th level monsters will often have other items worth 1+ gp
on
>them? Where else in Norrath can you find 1st level monsters dropping cloth
>armor?
>
>I had to hunt high and low in Freeport area for containers, yet in
Everfrost
>it seems like every other gnoll pup or goblin whelp drops a box, bag or
belt
>pouch. Oh, and there are 10,000 decaying skels which seem to have a 1 gp
>weapon about 25% of the time. Also, of the races I've seen it seems that
the
>Barbarians have the easiest shot at armoring themselves. Cubs for
bearskins
>are about 4th level or so, and are everywhere. Humans have to wait to kill
>tougher pumas. The Faydark folk have to fight over the 1 wolf that seems
to
>spawn every 10 minutes.
>
>Oh well, just my little rant for the day.
>
>On a lighter note, my most excellent traveling companions and I have set
out
>on a little adventure away from Freeport. Currently we are on Faydwer and
>have seen many cities and many zones. I highly recommend travel for anyone
of
>sufficient levels.
>
>Phoeble, Wandering Monk of Freeport
>

>
